tit.cmt: Kokumo を Kokumo/Kokubo (imperial mother) に修正しました。

sen.j: 国母（こくも/こくぼ）は、天皇、国王の生母の称号。
sen.e: Kokumo (or Kokubo) was a title for real mother of Emperor or King.
Kokumo (or Kokubo) is the title for real mothers of emperors or kings.
sen.cmt: was a title for real mother of Emperor or King をis the title for real mothers of emperors or kings に修正しました。NC_Check
sen.e: Kokumo (or Kokubo) is the title for real mothers of emperors or kings.

sen.j: 『職原抄通考』によれば「国母、治世天子御母也」とあり、あくまで現天皇の生母であり、皇后・皇太后など（天皇の正室）の地位とは異なるが、まれに皇太后の意で誤用されることもある。
sen.e: As "Shokugen Tsuko" describes 'Kokumo is the real mother of the reigning emperor', 'Kokumo' does not indicate the status of the Emperor's lawful wife as the Empress and the Empress Dowager; rarely though, 'Kokumo' is improperly used for the Empress Dowager.

As Shokugensho tsuko (Consideration on "Shokugensho" [history of governmental post]) describes 'Kokumo is the real mother of the reigning emperor', 'Kokumo' does not indicate the status of the Emperor's lawful wife as the Empress and the Empress Dowager; rarely though, 'Kokumo' is improperly used for the Empress Dowager.
sen.cmt: "Shokugen Tsuko" を Shokugensho tsuko (Consideration on "Shokugensho" [history of governmental post]) に修正しました。
sen.e: As Shokugensho tsuko (Consideration on "Shokugensho" [history of governmental post]) describes 'Kokumo is the real mother of the reigning emperor', 'Kokumo' does not indicate the status of the Emperor's lawful wife as the Empress and the Empress Dowager; rarely though, 'Kokumo' is improperly used for the Empress Dowager.

sen.j: 『日本三代実録』の元慶3年3月25日 (旧暦)（879年4月20日）条に、淳和天皇の皇后・正子内親王が崩御した時の記事として「淳和太后崩、既曰国母、可謂至尊」とあるのが初見。
sen.e: Kokumo first appeared in "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" entry dated April 20, 879 (25th day of the third month, the third year of the Gangyo era) in an article describing the demise of empress to Emperor Junna, Imperial Princess Masako: 'empress to Emperor Junna demised. On that day, Kokumo made a call of condolence.'

The word of 'kokumo' first appeared in an article of "Veritable Records of Three Reigns of Japan" (Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku), entry on March 25, 879 (in old lunar calendar) describing the demise of empress to Emperor Junna, Imperial Princess Masako: 'empress to Emperor Junna demised. On that day, Kokumo made a call of condolence.'
sen.cmt: Kokumo を The word of 'kokumo' に修正しました。"Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" entry dated April 20, 879 (25th day of the third month, the third year of the Gangyo era) in an article をan article of "Veritable Records of Three Reigns of Japan" (Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku), entry on March 25, 879 (in old lunar calendar) に修正しました。NC_Check
sen.e: The word of 'kokumo' first appeared in an article of "Veritable Records of Three Reigns of Japan" (Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku), dated on March 25 of the third year of the Gangyo era which says 'empress to Emperor Junna demised. On that day, Kokumo made a call of condolence' when the empress to Emperor Junna, Imperial Princess Masako passed away.
sen.cmt: Neilさん、赤字部分のチェックをお願いします。日記なので書かれてあるとおり「元慶3年3月25日」としました。

sen.j: また、天皇の生母ではないが、養母として天皇の養育にあたった后妃や、母に準ずる存在に擬せられた女性を「准母」という。
sen.e: On the other hand, although not the real mother of the crown prince but an empress or princess who fostered the crown prince as an adoptive mother or a woman who played the role of his mother is titled 'Junbo'.

On the other hand, although not the real mother of the crown prince but an empress or princess who fostered the crown prince as an adoptive mother or a woman who played the role of his mother is titled 'junbo' (a woman who was given the status equivalent to the emperor's birth mother).
sen.cmt: Junbo' を 'junbo' (a woman who was given the status equivalent to the emperor's birth mother) に修正しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, although not the real mother of the crown prince but an empress or princess who fostered the crown prince as an adoptive mother or a woman who played the role of his mother is titled 'junbo' (a woman who was given the status equivalent to the emperor's birth mother).

sen.j: 一条天皇生母の藤原詮子が出家して東三条院となって以来、国母・准母は出家後に女院号を受けるのが通例となった。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Senshi, the real mother of Emperor Ichijo, became a priestess and entitled Higashi Sanjoin, which set a precedent for Kokumo and Junbo to become priestess and then entitled Nyoin.

FUJIWARA no Senshi, the real mother of Emperor Ichijo, became a nun and entitled Higashi Sanjoin, which set a precedent for kokumo and Junbo to become nun and then entitled nyoin (a close female relative of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing).
sen.cmt: priestess を nun に修正しました。Kokumo and Junbo を kokumo and junbo に修正しました。Nyoin を nyoin (a close female relative of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) に修正しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Senshi, the real mother of Emperor Ichijo, became a nun and entitled Higashi Sanjoin, which set a precedent for kokumo and Junbo to become nun and then entitled nyoin (a close female relative of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing).

sen.j: 後の時代になると出家しなくとも女院となったり、また国母・准母以外にも女院号を受ける例も出た。
sen.e: In later ages, some of those who do not become priestess were also entitled Nyoin or some of those neither Kokumo nor Junbo were also entitled Nyoin.
In later ages, some kokumo were entitled nyoin without becoming a nun, or not all the kokumo had to be retired kokubo or junbo.
sen.cmt: some of those who do not become priestess were also entitled Nyoin or some of those neither Kokumo nor Junbo were also entitled Nyoin をsome kokumo were entitled nyoin without becoming a nun, or not all the kokumo had to be retired kokubo or junbo に修正しました。NC_Check
sen.e: At later times, there were cases of exception where the title nyoin was given to kokumo or junbo who did not become a nun, or even to those who were not kokumo or junbo.

sen.j: 明治維新以降は、国母の称は用いられなくなった。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, the title Kokumo has not been used.
After the Meiji Restoration, the title of kokumo has not been used.

sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, the title of kokumo has not been used.
